item.title: bryan add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "The individual cannot think and communicate his thought, the governor and legislator cannot act effectively or frame his laws without words, and the solidity and validity of these words is in the care of the damned and despised litterati...when their very medium, the very essence of their work, the application of word to thing goes rotten, i.e. becomes slushy and inexact, or excessive or bloated, the whole machinery of social and of individual thought and order goes to pot." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: bryan add a quote by T.E. Lawrence
item.description: "He was old and wise, which meant tired and disappointed..." -- T.E. Lawrence

item.title: bryan add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: bryan add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "To see what is in front of one’s nose needs a constant struggle." -- George Orwell

item.title: bryan add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: bryan add a quote by Charlie Kaufman
item.description: "Nothing happens in the world? Are you out of your fucking mind? People are murdered every day. There's genocide, war, corruption. Every fucking day, somewhere in the world, somebody sacrifices his life to save someone else. Every fucking day, someone, somewhere makes a conscious decision to destroy someone else. People find love, people lose it. For Christ's sake, a child watches her mother beaten to death on the steps of a church. Someone goes hungry. Somebody else betrays his best friend for a woman. If you can't find that stuff in life, then you, my friend, don't know crap about life. And why the FUCK are you wasting my two precious hours with your movie? I don't have any use for it. I don't have any bloody use for it." -- Charlie Kaufman

item.title: bryan add a quote by Leslie Knope
item.description: "The library is the worst group of people ever assembled in history. They're mean, conniving, rude, and extremely well-read, which makes them dangerous." -- Leslie Knope

item.title: bryan add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle." -- Plato

item.title: bryan add a quote by Elmore Leonard
item.description: "A man can be in two different places and he will be two different men. Maybe if you think of more places he will be more men, but two is enough for now." -- Elmore Leonard

item.title: bryan add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: bryan add a quote by John Leonard
item.description: "Isn't post-modernism really one big cover-up for the failure of the French to write a truly interesting novel ever since a sports car ate [author:Albert Camus|957894]?" -- John Leonard

item.title: bryan add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "There was a desert wind blowing that night. It was one of those hot dry Santa Anas that come down through the mountain passes and curl your hair and make your nerves jump and your skin itch. On nights like that every booze party ends in a fight. Meek little wives feel the edge of the carving knife and study their husbands' necks. Anything can happen. You can even get a full glass of beer at a cocktail lounge." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: bryan add a quote by Nick Cave
item.description: "I’m forever near a stereo saying, ‘What the fuck is this garbage?’ And the answer is always the Red Hot Chili Peppers." -- Nick Cave

item.title: bryan add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. No use being a damn fool about it." -- W.C. Fields

item.title: bryan add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. A psychotic is a guy who's just found out what's going on." -- William S. Burroughs
